title: Large-Scale Flipped Learning-Based Nursing Leadership Competency Enhancement Course: Focused on Patient Safety and Team Collaboration

context.prior_knowledge: Nursing license and basic clinical nursing experience (patient symptom assessment, application of basic treatment protocols)
context.additional_context: A training program for hospital nursing managers/leaders to strengthen practical competencies. Conducts project-based assessments in digitally equipped environments, emphasizing simulation activities centered on medical protocols and patient safety standards.

learning_goals: Achieve at least 80% comprehension of nursing theories (e.g., patient safety protocols, medical ethics) through flipped learning modules.

Score at least 90 points when adhering to protocols and meeting patient safety standards in 4 core nursing skills (blood pressure measurement, medication preparation, nasogastric tube insertion, blood glucose measurement).
Maintain at least 75% retention of knowledge related to patient diagnosis and treatment protocols for 3 months post-learning.
Perform interdisciplinary collaboration scenario-based nursing management simulation report writing and presentation through team-based projects.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
